content.body: Welcome bashi!  a question to you and Yoav Weiss about early hints: do they survive same-origin redirects?
content.formatted_body: Welcome bashi! a question to you and Yoav Weiss about early hints: do they survive same-origin redirects?

org.matrix.msc1767.message.body: Welcome bashi!  a question to you and Yoav Weiss about early hints: do they survive same-origin redirects?
Welcome bashi! a question to you and Yoav Weiss about early hints: do they survive same-origin redirects?

content.body: Noam Rosenthal: Our implementation is that they don't survive redirects including same-origin.
content.formatted_body: Noam Rosenthal: Our implementation is that they don't survive redirects including same-origin.

org.matrix.msc1767.message.body: Noam Rosenthal: Our implementation is that they don't survive redirects including same-origin.
Noam Rosenthal: Our implementation is that they don't survive redirects including same-origin.

content.body: I personally think this could be useful - even if it's not implemented yet. e.g. you submit a form which is going to do some heavy processing and then redirect you to somewhere - might as well start sending the 103s beforehand
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: I personally think this could be useful - even if it's not implemented yet. e.g. you submit a form which is going to do some heavy processing and then redirect you to somewhere - might as well start sending the 103s beforehand

content.body: I think changing the behavior isn't difficult. I think we can update our implementation if that's preferable and there is consensus.
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: I think changing the behavior isn't difficult. I think we can update our implementation if that's preferable and there is consensus.

content.body: bashi: OK, since the reserved client survives same-origin redirects, for now we'll leave it in the draft PR and we can discuss the specifics on Github

content.body: I guess the question is whether the preloads are preserved?
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: I guess the question is whether the preloads are preserved?

content.body: annevk: exactly, if you started preloading something and then redirected to somewhere else in the same origin, should you continue those preloads and then transfer them to the document
content.formatted_body: annevk: exactly, if you started preloading something and then redirected to somewhere else in the same origin, should you continue those preloads and then transfer them to the document

content.body: ... I think it's useful to allow that, but not sure if that has further implications
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: ... I think it's useful to allow that, but not sure if that has further implications

content.body: Nothing comes to mind, but you might get rather involved sequences... 103 302 103 401 103 200
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: Nothing comes to mind, but you might get rather involved sequences... 103 302 103 401 103 200

content.body: Speaking of which, I guess those questions apply to 401/407 too.
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: Speaking of which, I guess those questions apply to 401/407 too.

content.body: yea I believe we'll have only the first or last (most likely first) 103 in the sequence apply
